parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Profile ID.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific profile by id. Public facing. The ID of the profile may be the 40 character canonical ID as expressed in the search end-point or the legacy ID:
* The 32 character dockey or 40 character pid from api.dice.com
* The 34 or 42 character id from talent-api.dice.com/v1

If the resume cannot be retrieved, the rest of the profile data will still be returned to the caller successfully

parameters.name: originalFormat
parameters.description: Specify true to include the original resume format; false (or missing) to include the PDF version of the resume.

application/json.message: The required Profile ID suffix is missing. Valid suffixes are _i (integrated), _o (open web) or _t (Dice talent match).
application/json.developerMessage: The required Profile ID suffix is missing.

fieldMessages.errorCode: The required Profile ID suffix is missing. Valid suffixes are _i (integrated), _o (open web) or _t (Dice talent match).

post.description: Performs a Dice talent search.  A maximum of 10000 results will be returned by the search.  PageSize * Page will not go past 10,000

get.description: Performs a Dice talent search.  A maximum of 10000 results will be returned by the search.  PageSize * Page will not go past 10,000

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Specifies a full-text query string across all search fields.

When creating a query, list search terms separated by spaces, in the form q=term1 term2 term3; spaces must be URL encoded.

The search is case-insensitive.

To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: q="exact phrase".

The search supports logical operators AND/OR: q=term1 OR term2
Example: "Mechanical Engineer" OR mechanic

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
Specifies the central location of the search.   Can enter lat,long
Example  location=London
Example location=41.3434,19.332

Either q or location or both are required for a search

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Valid range is 1 to 50

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of profiles returned per page

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description:
Specifies the distance from the central location.
Example: 25.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: Specifies the distance unit of measure to use.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description:
Specifies the ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 country code of the search.
Multiple values can be specified using  commas, example US,GB.

parameters.name: hasEmail
parameters.description: When True filters results to only those profiles having an email address.

parameters.name: hasPhoneNumber
parameters.description: When True filters results to only those profiles having a phone number.

parameters.name: willingToRelocate
parameters.description:
Set to true to only include candidates willing to relocate. If a location is set on the search as well, exclude candidates currently in that location and include candidates with a preferred work area of that location or an unspecified preferred work area.
NOTE: If set to false, the filter is ignored

parameters.name: searchType
parameters.description: Candidate types that are being searched.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description:
Specifies a company from the company facet.
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma or a caret (^); a comma indicates OR where a cart indicates AND. Note that neither parentheses nor a mix of comma and caret are supported.

parameters.name: skills
parameters.description:
Specifies a skill from the skill facet (case sensitive).
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma (,) or a caret (^). A comma indicates OR; a caret indicates AND. Note that parentheses are not supported and operators cannot be combined. 
Examples: skills=Java,Python,JavaScript or skills=Java^PHP^MySQL

parameters.name: jobTitle
parameters.description:
Specifies a jobTitle from the jobTitle facet
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma or a caret (^); a comma indicates OR where a cart indicates AND. Note that neither parentheses nor a mix of comma and caret are supported.

parameters.name: educationDegree
parameters.description:
Specifies an education degree from the education degree facet
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma or a caret (^); a comma indicates OR where a cart indicates AND. Note that neither parentheses nor a mix of comma and caret are supported.

parameters.name: workPermit
parameters.description:
Specifies a work permit from the work permits facet
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma or a caret (^); a comma indicates OR where a cart indicates AND. Note that neither parentheses nor a mix of comma and caret are supported.

parameters.name: employmentType
parameters.description:
Specifies an employment from the employment type facet
Multiple values can be specified by either a comma or a caret (^); a comma indicates OR where a cart indicates AND. Note that neither parentheses nor a mix of comma and caret are supported.

parameters.name: annualSalary
parameters.description: Desired annual salary.  For a salary range [50000 TO 60000]

parameters.name: hourlyRate
parameters.description: Desired hourly rate of pay.  For a rate range you can send [50 TO 60]

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: Specifies the currency to use when filtering by annual salary or hourly rate.  By default currency is not restricted

parameters.name: lastActive
parameters.description: Include only people that were active (logged in to their profile) in the last x number of days.

parameters.name: yearsOfExperience
parameters.description:
Filters results to only those where the time of experience is at least x or more years, or in the range.

Example   4 
Example  [ 0 to 3]

parameters.name: socialProfiles
parameters.description:
Filter to return candidates with accounts from certain sites, e.g. github, stackoverflow, twitter

We support several hundred sites, but our list changes so we are choosing not to publish the list.

parameters.name: likelyToSwitch
parameters.description: When set to true, candidates are filtered to those who have logged in during the past 60 days or those who have shown cues related to job switching.

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: The name of the facet(s) to include in the response. Example facets=company,skills,jobTitle,employmentType,educationDegree,workPermit

parameters.name: sortByDirection
parameters.description:
Sort direction, ascending or descending.
This option is not available for a relevancy sort.  Relevancy sorts are always returned in descending order

parameters.name: excludeThirdParty
parameters.description: When true, search results will exclude candidates being represented by a recruiter. When this parameter is false or absent entirely, search results may contain a mix of candidates representing themselves and candidates represented by a recruiter.

parameters.name: dateResumeLastUpdated
parameters.description: Include only people that updated their resume in the last x number of days.

parameters.name: companyKeyword
parameters.description:
Finds candidates that have worked for a specified company. To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: company="DHI Inc". The search is case-insensitive.
The search supports logical operators AND/OR: term1 OR term2

parameters.name: skillsKeyword
parameters.description:
Finds candidates that have worked for a specified skills. To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: company="Java OR SQL". The search is case-insensitive.
The search supports logical operators AND/OR: term1 OR term2

parameters.name: jobTitleKeyword
parameters.description:
Filter.
Specifies the job title.
To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: jobTitle="exact phrase". The search is case-insensitive.
The search supports logical operators AND/OR: term1 OR term2.
Example: Software Engineer

parameters.name: onlyWithSecurityClearance
parameters.description:
Filter for candidates with security clearance
NOTE: If set to false, the filter is ignored

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
Filters candidates to those having the specified language(s).
The search supports logical operators AND/OR: term1 OR term2
Example: Italian or Spanish AND english or Spanish OR English

parameters.name: excludeFounders
parameters.description:
Filters out founders of a company.
NOTE: If set to false, the filter is ignored

parameters.name: hasPatent
parameters.description:
Filters candidates to only those having a patent application in its name.
NOTE: If set to false, the filter is ignored

parameters.name: skillYearsOfExperience
parameters.description:
Specifies skills with number of years of experience of that skill. Supplied as an array of term|years pairs.
To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks as part of the term: "exact phrase". The search is case-insensitive and supports logical operators AND/OR as part of the term.

Examples: ["JAVA OR J2EE|5"], ["PHP|10"] or ["PHP AND SQL|5"]. Note: ["PHP|5 AND SQL|10"] is not a supported format for this parameter, and should be passed in as separate pairs.

The provided value should be an array where every term|year pair will be treated as an AND. So ["PHP|8", "SQL|5"] will return profiles which have 8 years of PHP experience, and 5 years of SQL experience.

For more complicated queries such as ["PHP|8", "Apache OR Nginx AND FPM|3", "REST OR SOAP|3"], each individual term will be parsed as a boolean query, and then queried against in the index.

parameters.name: workPermitLocation
parameters.description: Filters profiles to only those having the provided work permit location(s) in its index data. To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: "exact phrase". Example: usa or mexico AND canada or canada OR usa

parameters.name: likelyToMove
companyCurrent
parameters.description: Use in conjunction with company parameter to return results where the current company matches.

message.description: Message that would help a developer figure out the issue

rel.description: This should be "self" for one of the links in the list.

field.description: The name of the field that errored

error_code.description: The unique code used to identify the error

message.description: The reason why the field errored

input.description: Used for IntelliSearch, text to be analysed, locations, skills, job titles and companies will be extracted from it.  The text must contain a skill to match on.
